@DesignsRosaron @CanalRiverTrust @Edwina_Currie @robertlargan @EnvAgency @Natures_Voice They've had nine days to stop this. Today the @CanalRiverTrust tell me there is no evidence of pollution passing our boat. We cleaned this up two hours ago. An hour later... https://t.co/BoHkR8noZj
@FoxesAfloat @CanalRiverTrust @Edwina_Currie @robertlargan @EnvAgency @Natures_Voice This is atrocious, this is nesting time for so much wildlife in the vegetation

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Say this again. If the same amount of sewage flowed down each individual highstreets action would be taken, but a river it is deemed acceptable as people don't care, its not their problem. When we loose what we have remember you was warned. This really boils my p**s
@FoxesAfloat @CanalRiverTrust @Edwina_Currie @robertlargan @EnvAgency @Natures_Voice Surely by now the source could have been traced and stopped??

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

tweets.text:
Me: So @EnvAgency, why have you taken pollution incidents and a target to reduce them out of your performance reports?
EA: We'll get back to you on that.
Me: *twiddles thumbs*
Me: Helloooo? Is anyone there?
EA:🤐

urls.title: Canals then and now | Canal & River Trust
urls.description: See how much our canals have transformed over the years.

tweets.text:
Today, our #Canals and #Rivers are vital green spaces where people can enjoy the outdoors. This is thanks to hard work of hundreds of pioneers and #volunteers. 🚶🌳 

Have a look at some of the most dramatic transformations in our interactive gallery 📖 https://t.co/4NHcgHaozy https://t.co/XdHTDskWfH

urls.title: Climate crisis hitting 'worst case scenarios', warns Environment Agency
urls.description: Sir James Bevan says extreme flooding in UK indicates urgent need for change if humanity is to survive

tweets.text:
"Our thinking needs to change faster than the climate. And... our response needs to match the scale of the challenge.” 

- @JamesBevanEA, Chief Executive of @EnvAgency 
https://t.co/KRC2cvTjQn

Day Nine.
The pollution is STILL emanating from Furness Vale Marina, stretching over a mile to New Mills. The boom at Bridge 29 isn't working and the polluting waste oil is just as bad as it was a week ago. Why is the slick still not being stopped at Bridge 30? @CanalRiverTrust https://t.co/9lxlWtbhQe

urls.title: BUILDING WITH NATURE STANDARDS BOARD — Building with Nature
urls.description: 26 March 2019, updated 27 April 2020 Building with Nature is delighted to announce the appointment of the organisation’s Standards Board. Eleven additional members join the Chair, Professor Alister Scott, and will act as the guardian body for the Building with Nature standards.

tweets.text:
Really signficant @BuildWithNature meeting today on standards review. Thanks to @planitpres @RichardBlyth7 @EPlanna @juliathrift @elainecresswll Welsh Govt, Scottish Govt, @TaylorWimpeyplc @Pinsent_Masons Vertigo @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts @thepmadden 
    https://t.co/C4UuCXumrx

Huge thanks to our contractors for helping us to establish much needed scrub along this beck in the Glenderamackin catchment - helping to #slowtheflow, provide habitat and create pockets of shade to keep watercourses cool when temperatures rise. Funded by #WEG and @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/5wXlf1uuAv

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Have I got this right? 
48 hours ago the @EnvAgency say better regulation is needed to protect the environment, and 24 hrs later they say they will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents of and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/0IefMSag90
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency So much for openness and transparency.

The @EnvAgency head says that the climate emergency is hitting “worst case scenario” levels.

5.2 million homes and businesses in England are already at risk of flooding.

Government must urgently reduce emissions and up its game on climate adaptation here and internationally.

tweets.text: @Ed_Farmer_Ford @EnvAgencyAnglia @EmmaHowardBoyd @NFUEastAnglia @thurrockcouncil @BBCEssex Whereabouts are you, Edward? I can have a chat with my colleague at ECC if it’s in their patch?

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency WTF, what is the point of the EA ? On multiple occasions we’ve reported repeated Glyphosate spraying at @saveseethingwells #seethingwells ,  a SINC site, turns out EA approved use for 1 plant (H.balsam) which does not grow there, no action by EA hoodwinked by owners 😥
